title: Where did the term “Indian giver” originate? - Quora
tags: Etymology of English Phrases (Origin or History of English Phrases)

response.answer_text: According to Google, “The concept of an "Indian gift" or an "Indian giver" traces its roots back to at least the 1700s. In his 1765 History of the Province of Massachusetts Bay, Thomas Hutchinson defined an Indian gift as a present for which an equivalent return is expected."

As far as I can think, every treaty or “deal” the US government made with the Indians was broken or taken back, reneged upon. So getting a contract with the government was like using toilet paper, full of sh*t.
